definition: to repeatedly commit an offense/repeat offender/habitual criminal/recidivist/recidivism
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: Punish recidivists with increased sentences is explicitly promulgated in many countries' penal codes.
sentences.chinese: 加重处罚累犯，在很多国家的刑法典中都有明确规定。

sentences.english: Essentially, Article 356 Of Penal Code stipulates special recidivist.
sentences.chinese: 刑法典第三百五十六条实质上是关于特别累犯的规定。

sentences.english: We should thus subordinate the prevention of first offences to the prevention of recidivism .
sentences.chinese: 这样一来，我们便会让预防初犯屈从于预防累犯。

sentences.english: Some people think that the system of units recidivism has been affirmed on by the existing legislation.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为现行立法已经规定了单位累犯制度。

sentences.english: Recidivist's system is that one kind is old and still has era systems.
sentences.chinese: 累犯制度是一种古老而又仍具时代性的制度。

sentences.english: Article 74 Suspension of sentence shall not be applied to recidivists.
sentences.chinese: 第七十四条对于累犯，不适用缓刑。

sentences.english: The attached skeletal muscle is involved by invasive carcinoma by direct extension.
sentences.chinese: 附属的骨骼肌被浸润性癌累犯，直接扩散。

sentences.english: You're the cutest jailbird I ever did see.
sentences.chinese: 你是可爱的累犯我从来没有看到的。

sentences.english: Recidivist offenders will face fines of up to$ 8 00000 and life imprisonment .
sentences.chinese: 累犯将面临高达八十万元罚款和终身监禁。

sentences.english: This dissertation is the research of unit recidivist on theory.
sentences.chinese: 本文是从理论上对单位累犯所作的研究。

sentences.english: The warden believes in segregation of first offenders from hardened criminals.
sentences.chinese: 监狱看守员认为得隔离初犯与累犯者。

sentences.english: The fifth part is the comparison about recidivism system.
sentences.chinese: 第五章是关于累犯制度的比较。

definition: to assess punishment/to determine the sentence (on a criminal)
culpable driving causing serious damage or injury
